revised_title: James Ernest Marsh: A Pioneer in Stereochemistry and Organic Chemistry
tldr: James Ernest Marsh was a prominent chemist known for his work in stereochemistry and organic chemistry. He made significant contributions to the understanding of the asymmetric carbon atom and its role in optical isomerism. Marsh's research on camphor and related terpenes helped advance the field of stereochemistry, and his work on the history of chemical discovery added to the unique identity of the Oxford Chemistry School.
